thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Thursday, 01 Mar 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Appeals panel eases bankruptcy's hard line toward marijuana

author: Jim Christie
title: Appeals panel eases bankruptcy's hard line toward marijuana
text:
A 92-year-old landlord whose bankruptcy was dismissed for renting a storefront to a marijuana business will get another day in court because the judge in her case did not fully explain how she was breaking federal drug laws.
A Bankruptcy Appellate Panel for the 9th Circuit in an opinion last month remanded Patricia Olsonâ€™s Chapter 13 case after finding the judge did not detail a bad-faith finding about her lease to support a conclusion she was violating the Controlled Substances Act.
To read the full story on Westlaw Practitioner Insights, click here: bit.ly/2oJfqv4
